intro: Cochlearia decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive cochlearia, is a flowering plant native to the British Isles. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, commonly known as the mustards, and is characterized by its small, white flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant is known for its deceptive appearance, resembling other species in its habitat, which can make it challenging to identify. It typically grows in coastal areas and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Cochlearia decipiens is a short-lived perennial that thrives in maritime climates.
